definition: to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!

sentences.english: And we scheduled it and we get it and my dad and my sister would help trim it.
sentences.chinese: 先做安排然后实践，爸爸和姐姐会帮忙修剪圣诞树。

sentences.english: If my little bit wrong incoming letter word disease sentence invites help correct that.
sentences.chinese: 如果我的来信有一些错词病句请帮忙纠正。

sentences.english: I have a homework about HTML need you for help. My group member can not do it!
sentences.chinese: 我有一个网页制作的作业需要你帮忙。

sentences.english: However, some help with chores and contributions to shared food are expected.
sentences.chinese: 然而，客人可以帮忙做些家务活，一起分享食物。

sentences.english: Excuse me, is it possible to see a doctor?
sentences.chinese: 劳驾，可以帮忙找个医生吗？

sentences.english: She said that memorizing the words of English songs helped a little.
sentences.chinese: 她说记风行歌曲歌词也有点帮忙。

sentences.english: For example, we now have e-friends to help us and keep us company.
sentences.chinese: 比如说我们现在有电子朋友帮忙，给我们做伴。

sentences.english: You say you could ask for the cat's help, but she is actually bringing luck to us, " Wakayama Electric spokeswoman Keiko Yamaki said.
sentences.chinese: 说是让猫来帮忙，但其实是她给我们带来了好运。

sentences.english: There’s still nothing much to do here, just watch TV or help with chores.
sentences.chinese: 在这里仍然无事可做，除了看电视和帮忙做家务。

sentences.english: The rider asked the corporal why he was not helping.
sentences.chinese: 骑马人问下士为什么不去帮忙。

sentences.english: With these, and a pair of crutches for back-up, a user can walk around.
sentences.chinese: 有了这些和一对拐杖帮忙，使用者可以走动。

sentences.english: Anyway, thank you for all your time.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，我非常感谢你的帮忙。

sentences.english: "You'll never beileve this one, "I told the office manager.
sentences.chinese: 我跟她说我们可以帮忙，并向部门经理提了出来。

sentences.english: Bob always resorts to me when he is in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 鲍伯有困难的时候总是让我帮忙。

definition: old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help out
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
enthusiasm/zeal/zealous/zest/enthusiastic/ardent/warmhearted
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to do sth in place of sb else
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
kindness/good intentions
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
to request sb to do sth/please!
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
to request help/to appeal (for help)
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
see 過來|过来[guo4 lai2]
to make a telephone call
